Node.definition: = man; ◄ son of Hilkiah (חִלְקִיָּה) ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Jeremiah (יִרְמְיָהוּ) prophet (נָבִיא)
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= town; ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► for Levites

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= man (called Ben Oni (בֶּן־אֹונִי) by his mother), tribe, and territory; ◄ twelfth and last son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and second son of Rachel (רָחֵל) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= man; ◄ son of Amon (אָמֹון) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (ca. 640 609)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה) ► father of Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) king of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= state in which a countable entity is three in number

Node.gloss: to reign|to be king|to be queen|to become king|to become queen
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= man, also known as Eliakim (אֶלְיָקִים) ◄ son of Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► king of Judah (609 597), appointed by Pharaoh Necoh (נְכֹה) who changed his name from Eliakim to Jehoiakim
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Amon (אָמֹון) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (ca. 640 609)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= state in which a countable object is eleven or the eleventh in number

= man; ◄ third son of Josiah (יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ) former name was Mattaniah (מַתַּנְיָה) ► described as one who did evil in the sight of the Lord; uncle of King Jehoiachin (יְהֹויָכִין) Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר) of Babylon (בָּבֶל) appointed him king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (597 587) following Jehoiachin's rebellion; he too rebelled against Babylon and was eventually taken captive to Babylon, his sons were killed and his own eyes put out; contemporary of Jeremiah (יִרְמְיָהוּ)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Amon (אָמֹון) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (ca. 640 609)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= action by which a group of people leave their country because they are forced to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= state in which a countable entity is the fifth in a range
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
literally: to know (someone); hence: = action by which deities single out humans from among their peers for a specific purpose
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
literally: to go out (from the womb); hence: = process by which children are born

= part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area
= causative action by which humans or deities set apart humans or objects for a particular purpose or activity relating to the service of God, as a result of which they become holy (קָדֹושׁ)
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
exclamation expressing grief and dismay
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to know how|to be skilful at
Node.definition: literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans have the experience, skill, and expertise to carry out a particular activity

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand|to stretch out (one's) right hand|to lay (one's) hand
Node.definition: = action by which humans stretch out their hand, right hand, or finger in order to do point with it or to put it in position for another action
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, either or not deliberately
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= causative action by which humans or deities give someone else a certain responsibility or position of authority with regards to an object, a group of people, or an entire land or nation

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= man; ◄ son of Hilkiah (חִלְקִיָּה) ► prophet (נָבִיא)

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
either the branch of a living tree or a branch that has been cut off in order to be used as a staff or rod

= a tree belonging to the peach family; growing wild, and reaching a height of 4.5 to 6 m; it sheds its oblong leaves in winter and produces white or pink flowers and blooms as early as January; the leaves appear much later; ◄ Prunis dulcis; ► the seed is fifty percent oil, and can be eaten raw or roasted
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= action by which humans perform activities with a certain amount of skill

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a countable entity is the second in a range

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a rounded container ◄ usually made of ceramic or metal ► used for storage or cooking
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
literally: to open an event; hence: = causative action by which humans cause or allow an event to happen
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics
= a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun‎, ◄ named after Mount Zaphon which is located in northern Syria
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= the outcome of a dispute between two or more parties, decided by a judge or a deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= to tie a belt or girdle around one's waist; ≈ often used metaphorically to denote arming oneself for battle, or, in a more abstract sense, to put on certain characteristics and qualities, such as strength, courage, and aggression
literally: to gird (one's) loins; hence: = action by which humans hitch up their mantle and keep it in place with a belt around their waist, ► in order to be able to walk or work

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to fear|to be afraid|to be discouraged
Node.definition: = state in which humans or animals lack inner strength and courage
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to lack inner strength and courage
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= population center that has been fortified with the help of a strong and solid wall and possibly other defense works; ≈ associated with security
= a tall, vertical structure ◄ made of metal, stone, or wood ► and used as support for a building or for decoration
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= person who is committed and able to resist both attacks, persecutions, and temptations ◄ as a wall

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans or deities engage in a confrontation with (other) humans
= process by which humans can complete a certain activity successfully
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
